subject: One Down...
event:
... and a bunch to go.

Watched the Jets/ Vikings game last night.  The one played while I was flying off to Dublin.  Thank you, Brett, for that last interception.  I was sweating it for a few minutes there.

(All the games after that one are still unplayed as far as I'm concerned, so no spoilers please).

Oh, people are asking about the two actors quarreling in Belfast.  Yes, it's true.  Saxon, who plays Nymeria, seems to have taken a dislike to Cooper, who plays Ghost, and when the two of them were off their leashes at the same time, well... but no one was seriously harmed.

On other fronts, look for SONGS OF LOVE AND DEATH and WILD CARDS, volume one at your local bookstore.  Both should be on the racks soon.  More when I get back.

Oh, and check out the Villains Tourney at Suvudu, where Ser Gregor Clegane has been battling for his life whilst I was overseas, slaying all manner of other dastards.  But he needs your help if he is going to prevail.

Off to Minnesota in an hour.

Oh, and for those of you who can't make the FFG event, I will also be signing at the Barnes & Nobel in Roseville, MN on Monday night:

http://store-locator.barnesandnoble.com/event/3067028

If it's a choice, though, the Days of Ice & Fire event will offer a lot more chance to hang and talk than the store signing.  I'll be reading a chapter from DANCE at the FFG event too.

comments.article:
Hope you have a great time in Roseville, MN. Btw, I have an ex who's from there and there's a great pizza place just outside of town. Classic New York-style. It's called Santonio's; the address is:

2420 New York Avenue, corner of New York and Denver St.
comments.subject: Have a safe trip!

comments.article:
OMIGOSH! Seriously, I need a helicopter -because I could be in MN in a few hours if I had one.

Are Nymeria and Ghost actually played by real wolves, or do they wolfish looking dogs?
comments.subject: A Reading From Dance!?

comments.article: your icon... AaaHHhHH!!! lol
comments.subject: Re: A Reading From Dance!?

comments.article: Tsk tsk, Saxon, you should have attacked the dog that plays Lady, it would have been more fitting. ;)
Its understandable, as Saxon will have more lines than Cooper, but Cooper should have more screen time than Saxon.  Its like Shatner and Nimoy all over again.
I guess they got the right animal to play Nymeria, fiesting thing she is. Would love some footage of the 'wolves' fighting! STARKS!
Monday night? During the NFC East divisional tilt between the Eagles and Redskins? Don't make me choose whether or not to go to the signing!
Don't any of those new-fangled phones get AM, FM or Sirius? I suppose you could listen to an internet streamcast.

Glad you got to watch the game :) I'm disappointed that I won't be at the signing since its so far away from where I live. You probably get lots of people asking questions and eager for the publication of Dance (that includes me haha). But Mr. Martin, I really want to tell you how much I love your books and that you have inspired me as a writer myself.

I'm a big fan of both GoT and Fantasy Flight Games (Just bought the GoT Board game this week finally) so I sooooo wish I could be at the event, but alas, TX and MN are too far apart.

Enjoy your trip, and try to get some rest soon.
comments.subject: Oh to be able to join you...

comments.article: I can't make it a week without coming across scores and standings.  Which then leads me to the box scores.  I can make it a day if I DVR a game, but sometimes even that is too long to avoid scores and highlights.  At least you got to see the MN vs Jets game before going to MN, so you can takj about that game with local fans.
comments.subject: How do you avoid the standings?

comments.article:
Best watch quickly. The real-time games start in two days! Don't want to have to TiVo them, too, and so on and so forth.

As a Dallas resident, I'll tell you that you can probably skip the Giants-Boys game on the 15th. Don't expect that to be much of a competition...
comments.subject: TiVo Football

comments.article: We even cooked up some snow, just for you.
Welcome to Minnesota. Enjoy your Days of Fire and Ice...we brought the Ice.
I only live 60 miles from Roseville, but I won't be able to make it. I hope you enjoy Minnesota hospitality...and the weather.
comments.subject: Minnesota

comments.article: Hey George.  Will you ever consider coming to Alaska?  I know how busy your schedule is, but am convinced you'd enjoy your time here.  We'd all love to see you.
comments.subject: Travel

comments.article: I wish I was there... :(
Man, I sure hope somebody tapes you reading that chapter from DANCE. Maybe you would be so kind as to post a link or a video on your blog here? *wink wink nudge nudge*
CONCUR! I hope someone at least has the good sence to make a cell phone video of it or something!
comments.subject: podcast/video

comments.article: I had a great time at the Days of Ice and Fire event even though I was unable to make the reading because of the weather.  Thanks for taking the time to connect with your fans.
comments.subject: Thanks for coming to MN.

comments.article:
I wouldn't be surprised if everyone here has already heard about the Worldbuilders charity and Patrick Rothfuss' involvement but I think it's worth mentioning anyway. He has collected some pretty awesome books from authors and publishers willing to donate new and hard to get fiction. Through donations to the charity you have a chance to win one of these fantastic books. If you would like more info because you would like to donate some money or a book or two if you happen to be an author you can look here:
http://blog.patrickrothfuss.com/2010/11/worldbuilders-2010/
Sorry that this post has nothing to do with your blog but I think it's a worthwhile cause that also piques the interest of any good fantasy enthusiast.
comments.subject: not sure where else to post this...

comments.article: next time your in Dublin take the DART(coastal train) to the Blackrock market on a sat or sun and ill meet you there for a chat and browse through the stalls.
btw Im a Packers fan crom Dublin :p
please come have one? you're my favorite author, ever. also, not to be a nag, but a dance of dragons? i've been dreaming about it being published.. i'm even going to splurge on hardcover, promise!
comments.subject: BOSTON MEET AND GREET

comments.article:
I completely second this request to come to Boston!!! In fact, Im such a big guy and I so wholly support this you could consider the notion thirded (is that a word?)!

I know your not a fan of New England sports, but New England nerds are fans of yours!!!

I know I could bring at least 8 people (who I have personally brought the joys of ASOIAF to). Oh what a cool day that would be.
comments.subject: Re: BOSTON MEET AND GREET

comments.article: REALLY wanted to be there.  I wasn't able to make it to Minny. :(  Had to work overtime, tried to take a jet outta Cleveland, got stuck in traffic at the corner of 26th and 20th streets :(  At least my friend Holmes was able to deliver at the last minute otherwise I woulda been stuck at work all weekend!
comments.subject: Hope you had a great time at Fantasy Flight!

comments.article: I just wanted to say what an honor it was to meet you this weekend at the FFG Event Center.  Also I wanted to apologize for the guy in the front row during the Q & A.  He was a total jerk for asking you what he did.  Not all of us fans are like that.  I love your work!  Hope I get the chance to meet you again someday!
comments.subject: Great Meeting You!

comments.article:
I hesitate to ask but my curiosity has no shame... What was it this total jerk asked? Honestly, I don't really expect an answer... but I had to ask.

PS you lucky duck getting your picture taken with the Grrm. ;P
comments.subject: Re: Great Meeting You!

comments.article:
Is Saxon a male dog? If Nymeria is to be played by a male... drat! There's a cringe-worthy noticeable physical difference between a male and a female dog.

Ah, well. Nothing that hasn't been done before. The "ferocious wolves" in "Hogfather" (which otherwise is a lovely movie) are nothing more than eager-to-please Tervuerens having fun. I've known and worked with too many of that breed to believe them wolves. For my part they might as well have substituted wolves with pink fluffy bunnies. Well... very quick and intelligent pink fluffy bunnies. With nice sharp teeth and a bad case of workaholicism (is that a word?).

Anyhow, at the moment I can't decide what I'm looking more forward to, this TV series or the next book. Both are going to be marvellous. Which reminds me, I need to go and practice my happy bouncing. Never know when it might come in handy...

but was thrilled to find your calendar on sale at my favorite online geek shop.


http://www.thinkgeek.com/homeoffice/posters/e63d/
comments.subject: Don't mean to crash the football thread,
